item.title: Report X-2024030992
item.description:
Report X-2024030992

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN THE TRAILER ON BAY 51. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE AND USING THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON ONE OF THE INNER PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS CRACKED AND LOOSE BY 1/6 OF A TURN, RESULTING IN TWO OUNCES OF LIQUID LEAKING OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO PACKING MATERIAL.

item.title: Report X-2024031004
item.description:
Report X-2024031004

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-16
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT IRREG SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED DRIPPING LIQUID AND EMITTING A SOLVENT-LIKE ODOR BY THE UNLOAD SUPERVISOR IN SECTION-B DOOR 13 ON THE CATWALK. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE AREA HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND CONTACTED THE DMP. A DESINGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 2 MINUTES WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND DONNING THE PROPER PPE. THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND A SMALL 6" RADIUS PUDDLE CLEANED UP, THEN ALL AFFECTED MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED A MINISCULE PIN-HEAD SIZE PUNCTURE HOLE AT THE CORNER OF THE BASE OF A 5-GAL POLY, CLOSED HEAD PAIL.
